Adjudicate.definition: to settle either finally or temporarily
Adjudicate.origin: [Latin adjudicare to award in judgment, from ad to, for + judicare to judge see judge ]

-catÂ·ing.definition: [Latinto award in judgment, fromto, for +to judge see]

1.definition: to settle either finally or temporarily (the rights and duties of the parties to a judicial or quasi-judicial proceeding) on the merits of the issues raised

2.definition: to pass judgment on as a judgesettle judicially

3.definition: to pronounce judicially to be [wasa bankrupt] [wasthe child's father]

4.definition: to convey by judicial saleto come to a judicial decisionact as judge [the courtupon the case]
